remarks: Apply a group homomorphism to a group sum, mapping version with implicit substitution.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 6-Jun-2019.)
statement:
gsummhm2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsummhm2.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsummhm2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
gsummhm2.h $e |- ( ph -> H e. Mnd ) $.
gsummhm2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsummhm2.k $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. B |-> C ) e. ( G MndHom H ) ) $.
gsummhm2.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> X e. B ) $.
gsummhm2.w $e |- ( ph -> ( k e. A |-> X ) finSupp .0. ) $.
gsummhm2.1 $e |- ( x = X -> C = D ) $.
gsummhm2.2 $e |- ( x = ( G gsum ( k e. A |-> X ) ) -> C = E ) $.
gsummhm2 $p |- ( ph -> ( H gsum ( k e. A |-> D ) ) = E ) $.
$d A k x $.
$d B k x $.
$d C k $.
$d D x $.
$d E x $.
$d G x $.
$d H x $.
$d X x $.
$d k ph $.
